together.translation[0].definitions[0].d: if two or more people do something together, they do it with each other
together.translation[0].definitions[0].e: We’ve very much enjoyed working together.
They’ve decided to spend more time together.
He and my father were at school together.
Together they went back inside the villa.
together.translation[0].definitions[1].d: if you put two or more things together, you join them so that they touch or form one whole thing or group
together.translation[0].definitions[1].e: He’d tried to glue the broken pieces together.
Mix the butter and sugar together.
He took the engine apart and then put it back together again.
The model was held together with string.
together.translation[0].definitions[2].d: if two people are together, they are married, or are having a romantic or sexual relationship
together.translation[0].definitions[2].e: Mark and I have been together eight years now.
A lot of people live together before getting married.
Sometimes I don’t know what keeps us together.
together.translation[0].definitions[3].d: if you keep, collect etc things together, you keep or collect them all in one place
together.translation[0].definitions[3].e: She keeps all the important documents together in one file.
Embarrassed, she gathered her things together and left.
Goods of a similar kind should be stored together.
together.translation[0].definitions[4].d: if you rub or hit things together, you rub or hit them against each other
together.translation[0].definitions[4].e: Max was rubbing his hands together with glee.
Knock the brushes together to clean them.
together.translation[0].definitions[5].d: if people are together, come together etc, they are or become united, especially in order to try and achieve something
together.translation[0].definitions[5].e: The Conference called on all good men to come together to resist socialism.
He said that the main purpose of the Baha'i faith was to bring people together.
together.translation[0].definitions[6].e: Both letters should have arrived. I mailed them together.
Right men. All together now ... push!
together.translation[0].definitions[7].d: when two amounts or quantities are added together, they are combined
together.translation[0].definitions[7].e: Add these numbers together and then divide the total by 7.
Together they won only 21% of the votes.
The table and chairs are together worth about £200.
together.translation[1].definitions[0].d: someone who is together is confident, thinks clearly, and does things in a sensible organized way – used to show approval
together.translation[1].definitions[0].e: Jane is such a together person.
